titleInfo.title: Unitonian Club Outing at Idaho Springs

physicalDescription.extent: 1 item (photograph), 7 x 14 inches, black and white
physicalDescription.note: Printed on the front of the photograph: ''Unitonian Club Outing. Idaho Springs, June 30, 1917'' and ''Rocky Mountain Photo Col., Denver.'' Handwritten on the back of the photograph: ''A list of numbers with ''5. Joe Alpert and 6. Betty Alpert.'' Also handwritten on the back: ''Mr. and Mrs. Joe Alpert and friends, Unitonian Club Picnic, Idaho Springs 1917, Donor Mr. Arnold Alpert, 19th and Stout?''

mods.abstract: A group of nineteen men and women stand on a street in front of an automobile in Idaho Springs, Colorado. Joe and Betty Alpert are fifth and sixth from the left. The men wear striped knitted caps with a tassel; the women and one man hold Japanese-style umbrellas. A man and a woman are standing behind a brick wall of a multi-storied building. A track runs down the street. The Unitonian Club was a Jewish club in Denver, Colorado.
mods.note: Donated by Arnold Alpert in December 1977.
mods.accessCondition: Copyright restrictions may apply. User is responsible for all copyright compliance.
